name: Maxeen's Theory A1S1
description:
Break mysterious ciphers and find cracks in the Forest's logic to assist a friendly scientist in her research.

Maxeen's theory is a "mystery game" where you collaborate with the community to collect breadcrumbs scattered throughout the game in order to progress. It's quite to how many Alternate Reality Games work.

Important
It's highly reccomended that you
A: join the discord or participate in the discussion board. This game is not intended to be taken on solo, but rather as a mystery that you unravel together.
And B: Give the prologue a try, as it gives you some context as well as acting as a "tutorial" for solving the mystery. 

When you find the passwords you can enter them at one of these links:
https://call-me-tess.itch.io/1-1-1

https://call-me-tess.itch.io/1-1-2a

https://call-me-tess.itch.io/1-1-2b

https://call-me-tess.itch.io/1-1-3

Made in Godot Engine

Most assets by Quentin McGlynn ("Call Me Tess"). Some audio recorded by Aysia Evans.

Damage shader from https://github.com/Ahopness/GodotRetro. Shader originally created by "keijiro", ported to Godot by Ahopness.

Some textures taken from CC0textures.com.
